intro: Fumaria numidica var. delicatula, commonly known as the delicate yellowweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. This variety is native to North Africa and the Middle East, where it thrives in dry, rocky environments. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
